task.summary: Default task
inputs create emergency default files when their parent dir is empty
gui does not freeze during calculation. Rudimentary popup now shows what step the first particle is at.

handling added for documents folders that exist externally. Also creates a new default config everytime on startup.
Need to find a way to explicitly set the python path for this project to include /Scripts, as right now it depends on ide specific worlplace settings. This introduces an extra headache layer for working with paths and import statements, as it has to be manually set up every time you clone this repo.
This is very annoying because VSCode's environment PYTHONPATH variable refuses to work with multiple paths sometimes. I want to add both the project root and Scripts/, but it has a hard time running with those in mind. The IDE totally finds it though. Very annoying.
deleted a few user generated files so I can add them to .gitingore
updated .gitignore
in progress: changing the output structure to hdf5
in progress: having every widget be able to initialize w/ the tempfile and last_used file
the init_temp method to populate the runtime tempfile dict now passes default values instead of throwing a KeyError when the expected key is missing from the lastused file.
fixed indexing issue preventing more than one file flush
added grid to dropdown figure, now trajectory subplots properly clear the magpylib collection so that there are no doubled up coils
changed the layout of the plot window graphs so that the trajectory and dropdowns are laid horizontally.
b-field graph now has a grid.

clamped the limits of the b-field streamplot on the calculation tab to be 1m + maximum coil offset.
The plotting tab now graphs the absolute value of the parallel component (dot product) to better match the nature of the perpendicular component (which already ignores signs because it's graphing the magnitude)
programmable output file directory
added a b magnitude lineout option that graphs the b field's magnitude from the origin to a corner (defined by the limit of the coil center + 1 meter)
b to corner graph now has an accurate title
added bob_dt to magpy4c1, need to change the scaling logic
bob_e option now points to the right dir in documents

dt widget now shows more information about the timestep scaling parameters.
You can now configure the reference particle location and the dynamic range used in the bob_dt calculation
updated the global adjustments widget in the coils tab
updated nothing about magpy4c1_01.py but now the e field doesnt shoot out so thats neat
reimplemented the rotations window autoclosing when clicking away from it. Now doesn't flag false positives when clicking within the window
added more failsafes to file reading; if the name of the file doesn't exist, doesn't try to read it
the progress window now closes automatically after a simulation finishes running and writing
updated graphs
E-field graphs for contour, streamlines implemented by fixing an orientation error. Results from the E field need to be rotated back after calculating w/ the coil's inverse rotation applied.
fixed typo in magpy4c1_01.py where I was using toCart instead of toCyl
added log(emag) lineout graph
the program now opens after widget init. to prevent flashing images from widgets loading on startup
removed the threading for the calculation step's bob_e implementation to test whether it is the source of e-value inconsistency between runs
e contour plot is now on the log of the magnitude
made the field_methods_impl's theta have the np.float64 dtype just in case

added 'np.empty(0).sum()' in EfieldX inside magpy4c1_01.py to test whether numpy's backend multithreading could cause e_field differences on the same system.
e_field differences on different systems are currently theorized to be because of floating point rounding and is separate from this.

added 'np.empty(0).sum()' in EfieldX inside magpy4c1_01.py to test whether numpy's backend multithreading could cause e_field differences on the same system.
e_field differences on different systems are currently theorized to be because of floating point rounding and is separate from this.

added 'np.empty(0).sum()' in EfieldX inside magpy4c1_01.py to test whether numpy's backend multithreading could cause e_field differences on the same system.
e_field differences on different systems are currently theorized to be because of floating point rounding and is separate from this.
added a bob_e debug logger test to compare values across systems
changed rho comparison from == to math.isclose when checking if value is 0
added abs_tol argument to isclose argument
added abs_tol argument to isclose argument again to 1e-5
added abs_tol argument to isclose argument again to 1e-10

edited the implementation of bob_e used in the program with the math.isclose() logic experimented with in tests.
The culprit of different values across systems was shown to be due to scipy's rotation functions returning floating point values ~1e-16 instead of 0 on some, while others do return 0.
While the acutal values of floating point numbers ~1e-16 and 0 are both very small, this large absolute magnitude difference has huge repercussions when plugged into the solution.
The currently implemented absolute tolerance value of 1e-10 means that any given value greater than 1e-10 will be used as is, while smaller values will always be clamped to 1e-10. This change will ideally cover the entire range of possible variation of values from scipy's rotate, or enough where there is negligible differences between operating systems.
another change to the 0 comparison. Added several numpy array conversions to dtype np.float64 in the orienting point step to ensure that all numbers are using double precision
lineout changes to the ring field version 2
e field now looks at the updated collection
e field now looks at the updated collection

dt widget now shows more information about the timestep scaling parameters.
You can now configure the reference particle location and the dynamic range used in the bob_dt calculation
updated the global adjustments widget in the coils tab
updated nothing about magpy4c1_01.py but now the e field doesnt shoot out so thats neat
reimplemented the rotations window autoclosing when clicking away from it. Now doesn't flag false positives when clicking within the window
added more failsafes to file reading; if the name of the file doesn't exist, doesn't try to read it
the progress window now closes automatically after a simulation finishes running and writing
updated graphs
E-field graphs for contour, streamlines implemented by fixing an orientation error. Results from the E field need to be rotated back after calculating w/ the coil's inverse rotation applied.
fixed typo in magpy4c1_01.py where I was using toCart instead of toCyl
added log(emag) lineout graph
the program now opens after widget init. to prevent flashing images from widgets loading on startup
removed the threading for the calculation step's bob_e implementation to test whether it is the source of e-value inconsistency between runs
e contour plot is now on the log of the magnitude
made the field_methods_impl's theta have the np.float64 dtype just in case

added 'np.empty(0).sum()' in EfieldX inside magpy4c1_01.py to test whether numpy's backend multithreading could cause e_field differences on the same system.
e_field differences on different systems are currently theorized to be because of floating point rounding and is separate from this.
added a bob_e debug logger test to compare values across systems
changed rho comparison from == to math.isclose when checking if value is 0
added abs_tol argument to isclose argument
added abs_tol argument to isclose argument again to 1e-5
added abs_tol argument to isclose argument again to 1e-10

edited the implementation of bob_e used in the program with the math.isclose() logic experimented with in tests.
The culprit of different values across systems was shown to be due to scipy's rotation functions returning floating point values ~1e-16 instead of 0 on some, while others do return 0.
While the acutal values of floating point numbers ~1e-16 and 0 are both very small, this large absolute magnitude difference has huge repercussions when plugged into the solution.
The currently implemented absolute tolerance value of 1e-10 means that any given value greater than 1e-10 will be used as is, while smaller values will always be clamped to 1e-10. This change will ideally cover the entire range of possible variation of values from scipy's rotate, or enough where there is negligible differences between operating systems.
another change to the 0 comparison. Added several numpy array conversions to dtype np.float64 in the orienting point step to ensure that all numbers are using double precision
lineout changes to the ring field version 2
e field now looks at the updated collection
